clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of a Diagnostic Medical Device for the INR (International Normalized Ratio) Measurement
clinical_study.official_title: Conformity Measurement Assessment of a Diagnostic Medical Device Used for the Measurement of the INR (International Normalized Ratio)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the measurement conformity of an in vitro diagnostic device measuring the INR (International harmonized Ratio).

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators will assess the performance of an in vitro diagnostic device for assessing the INR.
The evaluation will consist of make several INR measurements using the device and compare these measures to the reference value.
The INR will be measured using the study device on capillary blood drops taken from the fingertip. In the same way a venous blood sampling will be carried out to measure a reference INR.
A total of 20 healthy subjects and 180 patients treated with vitamin K agonist will be enrolled in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of measurement of the INR with the study device
primary_outcome.time_frame: Just after the blood taken at day 1
primary_outcome.description: The INR value of each measure with the study device will be compared to the reference INR measured by a central laboratory on a concomitant venous blood sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Repeatability of measurement of the INR with the study device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Just after the blood taken at day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of 8 INR measurements performed with the device in a range of 15 minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reproductibility of measurement of the INR with the study device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Just after the blood taken at day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of 8 INR measurements performed with the device in a range of 15 minutes. The modified parameters between measurements will be the lot of consumables and the study device

intervention.description: the procedure involves a series of repeated measurements of INR with the studied device
intervention.other_name: In vitro diagnostic device measuring INR

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients treated with vitamin K agonist or healthy volunteers
- For healthy volunteers : Body Mass index between 18 ans 29 kg/m²
- No acute disease in the previous month
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant woman
